title: Jennifer Aniston reveals she turned down Saturday Night Live cast spot because it was a 'boys club'
text:
Jennifer Aniston has revealed she turned down being a Saturday Night Live cast member because of the 'boys club' environment.

The 50-year-old was still an up-and-coming actress when she had the chance to speak with SNL producer Lorne Michaels about joining the show, she revealed on Howard Stern on Monday.

Not only did Jennifer decline the spot, she even told Lorne the workplace culture was not the best place for women.

'I didn't think I'd like that environment': Jennifer Aniston said she was turned off by the 'boys club' culture of Saturday Night Live

'I didn't think I'd like that environment,' Jennifer admitted. 'I remember showing up and [Adam] Sandler was there, and [David] Spade was there, and I had known them already. And they were like, "Look at Aniston here!"'

Jennifer expressed her concerns about the workplace culture during her meeting with Lorne.

Now she admits she was in over her head.

'I was such a young twit, I was like, "I think that women need to be treated better here,"' she said.

Standing up for herself: Aniston expressed her concerns about the workplace culture to Lorne

'I was such a young twit': Aniston admits now she was in over her head

SNL legends: Aniston remembered running into SNL stars Adam Sandler and David Spade ahead of her meeting with Michaels

'Because it was such a boys club, you know, you're just not the brightest when you're in your early 20s.'

She insisted she wasn't lecturing him, but rather expressing her needs in a workplace.

'I was just saying what I would hope if I was to do this, what I would hope it would be,' she explained.

How did he react? Howard asked how Lornes reacted to her observations, which Jennifer replied by mimicking his reaction: with a scowl and a slow nod (Lornes pictured September 2019)

Friends forever: Though Friends had not yet reached her radar, she would ultimately find super stardom after landing the role of Rachel Green on the hit sitcom

Howard asked how Lornes reacted to her observations, which Jennifer replied with a scowl and a slow nod.

Fortunately, luck was still on Jennifer's side after she turned down the position.

The actress went on to find fame as Rachel Green on the hit show Friends, which was not yet on her radar at the time she was being considered for SNL.

Jennifer wasn't completely done with SNL either - she would still go on to make guest appearances over the years as a result of all her fame.
description: Jennifer was still an up-and-coming actress when she had the chance to speak with SNL producer Lorne Michaels about joining the show, she revealed on Howard Stern on Monday.
